org.webcycle.hexml
Class HexmlObject

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.webcycle.hexml.HexmlObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
BasicAtom, BasicContainer, HexmlString
public abstract class HexmlObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements iHexmlObject

Simple implementation for parsable objects, providing basic utility functions for xmlish parsable objects, such as parsing/printing attribute lists, etc. The parsing method(s) - eg parseAttributes() and parseAttributeValue() require a subclass, but the printing methods - att_toString(), etc., are static.

Method Detail

parseAttributes

public void parseAttributes(java.io.BufferedInputStream source)
Parse the attributes of a tag. The next read() will be the first char of the first attribute.
Specified by:
parseAttributes in interface iHexmlObject

parseAttributeValue

public void parseAttributeValue(java.io.BufferedInputStream source,
                                java.lang.StringBuffer attname,
                                int firstChar)
                         throws java.io.IOException
parse the value of the attribute. The next read() will give the first character after the double quote. This default implementation will read all characters until a double quote is found, and invoke setAttribute(attname, value). Subclasses can override this to implement more interesting functionality, such as interpreting specific notation like "a.b.c" or "a.b()", etc.
Specified by:
parseAttributeValue in interface iHexmlObject

Field.set(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)

fields_toString

public static java.lang.String fields_toString(java.lang.Object o)
Serialize the public java fields of the object o as attributes of the xml tag. Returns a string of the form f1="v1" f2="v2" f3="v3" ... where f are the names of the java fields, and v are the result of invoking toString() on each field object. invokes att_toString on each public java Field object of the object o. The resulting String begins with a space. If an IllegalAccessException is caught when trying to access a field, it is silently skipped.
See Also:
Field

initialize

public boolean initialize(iParseContext context)
Default initialization; does nothing other than return true. When invoked by the parser, this behavior tells the parser to add this object to the currentContext with its default way. Subclasses can change that behavior by overriding initialize() to do it themselves, in which case they should return false (unless they also want the default behavior).
Specified by:
initialize in interface iHexmlObject
See Also:
org.webcycle.hexml.Parser#foundNewObject

initialize

public static final void initialize()
Deprecated.  
old interface - made final so no subclasses can implement it.
